sessions.title: RFP Share Out

sessions.description: Coffee, light breakfast, mix and mingle.
sessions.title: Doors Open & Registration

sessions.description: get fired up and ready to activate our community
sessions.title: Welcome Orientation

sessions.description:
Join workshops on tools, strategies and best practices lead by Hive members and friends.
Workshops help introduce new ideas that might support solution designs during the hack day.
sessions.title: Skillshare Sessions

sessions.description:
Establish goals, make decisions, plan for outcomes and co-create programs.
Activators lead sessions to enable solutions and scope out work with participants.
sessions.title: Working Group Sessions

sessions.description: Keep the momentum going with a boxed lunch, or take a moment to yourself and eat in peace.
sessions.title: Grab 'N Go Lunch
Debrief/Share out

sessions.description: You’re invited to attend a skillshare to learn more about Rec2Tech Pittsburgh. Join The Sprout Fund (Pittsburgh) to explore how communities and local government are responding to Former President Obama’s Nation of Makers initiative.
sessions.title: Rec2Tech: Integrating Digital Literacy in Municipal Spaces
How to be a Skillful Ally

sessions.description: Learn easy tips to reducing your online data trails.
sessions.title: Reducing Your Data Trail

sessions.description: Learn the latest programming data from Chicago City of Learning and how you can get involved.
sessions.title: State of CCOL

sessions.description: This session will share the intention of conducting a study to understand the landscape of digital media use (and goals for that use) in Chicago.
sessions.title: What are you doing, how are you getting there and how will you know when you arrived?

sessions.description: Data Management , Not Just For Developers. Learn how to effectively collect, manage, and report your data from the perspective of an educator, data manager, and developer.
sessions.title: Designing a Data System- A Three Dimensional Skill-Share (Educator, Data Manager, and Developer/Coder)

sessions.description: Hear an overview of and ask questions about the "Future Directions" report for Hive Chicago
sessions.title: Where is Hive Going? The "Future Directions for Hive Chicago" Report

sessions.description: This session will focus on using the work of FUSE as a case study for how an informal organization can work successfully with schools and teachers to increase its impact and reach more young people.
sessions.title: Formalizing the informal: Lessons learned from FUSE’s journey into the school day.

sessions.description: Join Bex and Sarah to learn about the daily data trails of youth and useful toold to protect it.
sessions.title: A Day in the Life of Youth Data

sessions.description: The Chicago Architecture Foundation will share their experience designing and producing their Discover Design Platform.
sessions.title: Designing an Open Platform Website to Meet the Needs of a Network

sessions.description: Need some new and refreshing activities for programs? Come learn about GeoConvos!
sessions.title: Geo Convos

sessions.description: Learn about Hive Toronto's "by youth, for educators" cyberbullying project. A resource to help educators have better conversations about cyber bullying.
sessions.title: The Ca.pture Project

sessions.description: Switch a circuit between being on and off, different values in different cultures and different backgrounds with culturally-responsive, tactile electronics!
sessions.title: Youth in Motion

sessions.description: Building from the “Better living through online security & encryption” guidelines (bit.ly/cryptochecklist), this session will teach participants how to protect their online activities, communications, and information in their own lives and in the context of working with immigrant/refugee/undocumented youth.
sessions.title: Organizational Digital Security 101

sessions.description: The future of PD is participatory, teacher-powered + choice-based. BYOD to this hands-on workshop and learn to curate resource collections, organize EdChats and build online PD courses w/ participate.com.
sessions.title: Twitter Chats, EdCamps and Digital Badging: How To Build a Collaborative Learning Network

sessions.description: Learn tips for effective social media campaigns  for a specific target audience with focused messaging and interesting content.
sessions.title: Best Practices for Developoing Social Media Campagins

sessions.description: Session will provide an overview of the Smart Chicago Collaborative-Youth Led Tech program.
sessions.title: Youth Led Tech: Technology in the Context of Needs and Entrepreneurship

sessions.description: Join the Mozilla Gigabit team for a workshop focused on demystifying high speed internet and helping you take advantage of Chicago’s high speed networks.
sessions.title: Harnessing High Speed Internet for Your Community

sessions.description: Creating constructive collaborative interactions between teachers and youth serving organizations.
sessions.title: How might we best reach/access teachers to collaborate and provide professional development and educational resources?”

sessions.description: Sometimes we fail to deliver for teens. Let's learn from those challenges and use this working group to better incorporate Youth Voice into our programming.
sessions.title: Youth Voice: When We've Failed the Youths

sessions.description: Apply #SystemsThinking as an approach to mapping & supporting a neighborhood level learning network in Austin with community stakeholders.
sessions.title: Ecosystem Building in Austin and Beyond

sessions.description: Everyone's an expert in something, how about we learn how to share it through our Hive Network? Help us to develop a Hive Peer Learning Community!
sessions.title: Developing a Peer Learning Community

sessions.description:
How is Chicago a sanctuary city for youth? We want to bring together teachers, stakeholders, youth, civic agents to: 
Figure out sustainable ways to pay all youth without compromising the statuses of undocumented youth.
sessions.title: Supporting Undocumented Youth in a Sanctuary City

sessions.description: The Bronzeville Fusion Network will be providing 4 days of programming (100 slots a day) for students attending 1 of 6 schools in the Bronzeville neighborhood. Learn how you can get involved!
sessions.title: DYN's Bronzeville Fusion Network

sessions.description: Space 8 is for  from skillshares that are turning into project ideation and need more time and space to geek out!
sessions.title: Renegade- the skillshare that just can't stop

sessions.description: Join IMPACT and NVAM as we share community Project that activates Quality of Life Moonshot goals-- share best practices and make some art with us!
sessions.title: Quality of Life In Focus: Activating Community Through Open Dialogue, Art and Technology

sessions.description: Join us for our Hive Chicago Buzz Science Fair- leading organizations and institutions from Chicago’s education landscape will share their work including Sweetwater Foundation, NEIU’s Maker Space, Maker Mob and Make Take Teach Fair, the Lincoln Park Zoo, Chicago Architecture Foundation, Yollocalli Arts Reach, STEAM STUDIO, SMART Chicago, Code Create, Mozilla’s Digital Security Advocates plus more! Make sure you join Bit Bash to play some indie video games and Mozilla’s Virtual Reality Room.
sessions.title: Science Fair
